title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin)
Interview Descriptions: It is good they will ask you experience and you cv and actually see your gpa and the undergraduate school and the project you have done in the college . Totally is good for one year
Interview Questions: Introduce yourself and your experience

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in Jun 2023
Interview Descriptions: The experience was pleasant and seamless. The referees were friendly and provided informative feedback, discussing future plans and personal growth opportunities in detail. The interview was concise yet intuitive, making for a productive and efficient interaction.
Interview Questions: What is your research methodology?

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin)
Interview Descriptions: Firstly they asked me some technical questions and then request me to prepare presentation based on the topic they mentioned. Everything was very Easy and straightforward. After some weeks they offered me the position.
Interview Questions: Ask me about my Educational background and to prepare presentation

title: Senior Laboratory Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: Just one interview with four people, basic interview questions and technical questions quick response from the team, HR can be slow to get things moving but are very responsive to emails.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you made a mistake how was it resolved

title: Technical Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University College Dublin (Cork)
Interview Descriptions: Very thorough. A lot of technical questions were asked. The board consisted of 4 interviewers. The interview lasted 25 minutes. Aspects of technical, administration, health and safety, and general management were asked.
Interview Questions: Describe your experience working with cell cultures.

title: Marketing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University College Dublin
Interview Descriptions: Took place with a three-person panel interview asking competency-based questions.  Some open questions and some closed. Overall a good experience. Referred to application detail showing they had studied it thoroughly.
Interview Questions: Describe your data analytics skills and how you would use them in this role.

title: Operations Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University College Dublin in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: Competency based interview, opportunity to add info at the end. Interview via zoom. Interviewers were pleasant and friendly. Interview itself was short. Not much time to demonstrate personality. Typical public service interview.
Interview Questions: What is your leadership style?

title: Technical Officer Locum Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process was on first floor of the building with a seating area on campus near the lake type of structure. It took me 20 minutes on campus to find the directions to the interview location.
Asked if I know how to perform billing as a scientist. I think that was the question I should have said I am excellent with data and can do this task. 
Good experience. Spoke about dog wound samples and Bordatella can cause whooping cough in canines in microbiology diagnosis. Learned a lot.
Interview Questions: Have you used the Vitek before?

title: Post Doctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: They have a fixed set of questions. First you have to present your work, make sure that you focus on the work that is relevant to the project. After the presentation you are asked at least 3 questions from each member of the committee.
Interview Questions:
Describe your publications,  how many are there, what journals did you publish in?
How do you manage time constraints?
Have you ever used a time management software?
How do you make collaborations?
What will be your first step towards the completion of the tasks outlined by the project?
Do you make decisions on your own regarding publications?
Did you publish your original ideas or was it somebody else?

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University College Dublin
Interview Descriptions: Standard interview procedure process was followed with scientific PI who had research funding available. One other researcher was also present. Questions asked about research experience, knowledge of project, problem solving and general scientific  conversation.
Interview Questions: Questions asked about theoretical, practical, statistical knowledge relating to project and then general Questions about science.

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University College Dublin in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: Zoom based interview with three panel members, general questioning on competency regarding the specifics of the potential project and examples of expertise in the specified field. Due to the project focusing on a specific type of VR experience, the focus of the interview was based on how one would achieve this within a hard set deadline.
Interview Questions: How much experience do you have developing prototype VR experiences in a short time frame.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University College Dublin in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: The whole process was quite impersonal and felt a bit scattered and rushed. Had marking system for feedback but no free text so hard to know how/why decisions were made.
Interview Questions: How you would deal with anaphylaxis

title: Digital Marketer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: The good process I would really suggest people work for this company as I learned a lot from them in my career I got a promotion in my next company because of this
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions:
To the point
Organised process that gave developmental questions throughout, would be good to give a heads up on how interview process will be carried out prior to interview - also job description not accurate
Interview Questions: My experience in tech environments

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: Zoom interview with three employees of the College in which the position was based, one of which would be a direct manager. One asked general questions, one asked about qualitative methodology and one quantitative methodology. Also required to prepare a 5 minute presentation.
Interview Questions: How would you go about motivating students to participate in a research project you are involved in?

title: Chinese Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: firstly you should apply online,  send your CV,  then you will have 15 min interview,  ask about your previous job, visa type and so on, then it's one phone interview,  finally, there is a trial lecture
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University College Dublin in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: Chosen for interview two weeks after submitting application. Interview took place via Zoom, was a fairly standard competency based interview. Heard from interviewers about one week later that I was unsuccessful.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University College Dublin in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: They asked between 5 - 6 general interview questions. Their demeanour was friendly and direct throughout. The interview was over zoom and was 30 minutes long. Each person on the panel took turns asking questions specific to their research expertise.
Interview Questions: How does my experience apply to the role

title: Marketing Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University College Dublin (Blackrock, Dublin)
Interview Descriptions: Several rounds. The main round consists of a group interview and is like a presentation. You're given a random item and asked to pitch it with another interviewee.  You're interviewed by current marketing advisors. There's about 8 applicants per interview group.
Interview Questions: what is your biggest weakness?  why do you want to be an advisor?

title: Marketing Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University College Dublin
Interview Descriptions: Just one  round of interviews which was a  panel with three people. It felt very formal.   Routine questions based on job spec. I felt there was very little engagement and my responses was simply noted with no follow-up questions. No opportunity to ask   questions about the role. When I asked one question it was answered with the minimal amount of information.  Everyone was very pleasant.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had to juggle a lot of competing priorities.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was quick and easy. I was contacted by HR within a week from the application and was offered an interview. The interview took place a few days after that.
Interview Questions: What are the challenges education faces

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions:
a panel of 4 staff interviewed me for the position. I submitted my application to the department head and was called for interview 2 weeks later.
A second interview took place 1 week later . this was a number of years ago in the 1980's so it may be different now
Interview Questions: Relating to Team work and research ability

title: International Student Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: CV and cover letter submitted -  task based interview (research and prepare presentation demonstrating understanding and knowledge of role and sector) followed by panel asking questions on presentation and to also expand on CV.
Interview Questions: Can you give examples of when you demonstrated good customer service?

title: Research Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin)
Interview Descriptions: Had an informal coffee with a department manager where we discussed what the role consisted of, what was expected, etc. Then went through the formal process which consisted of an onsite interview with the same manager but also a HR representative which consisted of very formulaic questions, that seemed unnecessary. The job offer seemed to have been totally up to the manager and my answers to the questions didn't really seem to matter much.
Interview Questions: "describe a time you succeeded at work" etc

title: Audit Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Telephone screening (recruiter)
Telephone interview (client)
Face-to-face interview (client and recruiter)
Reviewing notes and discussing candidates (recruiter and client)
Conducting reference checks (recruiter)
The in-person job interview is typically a one-on-one interview between the applicant and a hiring manager. The interviewer will ask questions about the applicant's experience and skills, work history, availability, and the qualifications the company is seeking in the optimal candidate for the job.
Interview Questions:
why this company
why you
why this position

title: English Language Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin)
Interview Descriptions: Referred by a colleague, sent letter of application, invited to interview, interview panel of two, I then had to submit a follow up task in the form of a detailed lesson plan.  References were then,  requested.  References were taken up very quickly and I received an offer letter received.
Interview Questions: What methodology do you follow in your teaching?

title: Front Desk Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: Individual interview about your experience and job related competency questions. Asked about any affiliations to clubs or societies in UCD and if you could act as a neutral party if conflicts arose.
Interview Questions: Describe a challenging experience you have had in a workplace and how did you overcome it?

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was with a panel of 3 people. General questions related to work experience and personality have been asked . Results were within next 24 hours. Really nice experience.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to work in academia?
Where do you see yourself in 5 years time?

title: PhD Candidate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: I applied online for a phd position and after some days I got an email to provide my CV and Diploma. After that a skype interview was conducted with a professor.
Interview Questions:
Research Experience
Thesis Work 
Software Skills

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University College Dublin
Interview Descriptions: It was pretty standard over all.  I applied through the UCD website, and it was during the Christmas period, so it took longer than usual. A recruiter got in touch with me to say that I was shortlisted, and set out a date and time for the interview.
Interview Questions: What do you know about UCD's policy and procedures?

title: Student Caller Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interactive Group interview. Given a list with 20 items. Asked which items (Map, torch, etc,)  you would bring to the Moon. Only some of the items are suitable. I.E Compass is an option but clearly wont work when you bring it with you. Following this you are given a random topic and asked to speak for one minute on it. Topics include Ware-wolf vs Vampires, Apple vs Samsung, etc etc. Last task is a mock phone call. You are given scenario sheet about the prospect you are calling, what you are collecting for, etc and have to try and persuade the interviewer to donate
Interview Questions:
What would you bring to the Moon ?
Tell me about Ware-wolfs and Vampires ?
Mock phone call - how do I know this is a legitimate cause?

title: Academic Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Must be an incoming UCD student  with 6 H1s from first sitting of the LC (though not necessarily 625 points). Everyone is therefore very strong academically, talk about your academic interests and extra-curriculars  rather than your  academic strengths. Everyone is as smart as you.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose to attend UCD?

title: Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions:
3 people interviewing, a question each in which they grade. Extremely structured, too structured, all too 'academic' at times. The room had windows, though none were open, the room was like a sauna, so exceptionally difficult to sit in a suit and tie throughout. 
The first question was to define understanding of the term 'talent pipeline' which was typically college; it seemed strange to define a term rather than being asked to explain a process. I just don't understand how the ability to define a word makes you a stronger candidate. 
I acquired feedback and I thought the marking was unfair at times. The details they gave and described as 'extremely difficult' when dealing with '8 stakeholders' - to an experienced recruiter who may deal with 50 clients at a time, this is a walk in the park. They didn't really buy into any commercial awareness or a commercially savvy response to a situation or innovation. I think it's set out to find a particular type person - from my own experience, I think they underestimate the important of character, drive and actual performance. 

Overall I found all details in the interview very straight forward. There were elements that I've encountered as the basics of my current role for the past 5 years. Though the marks received totally contradicted this. Though I'm unsure of how they mark it and the criteria it falls under. I felt it was marked more as an exam than an opinion of somebodies capability to excel in a role.
Interview Questions:
Define the term ______ .....
Give an example of where (insert politically correct jargon they're trying to comply with)?

title: Telephone Campaigner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University College Dublin in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was a grouped interview process with many other applicants. We were given exercises and tasks to do and were judged based on the ideas we came up with and how we responded to particular situations that may arise.
Interview Questions: Q: what previous experience do you have applicable to this role?

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very short. There were two post docs and the PI. The interview was informal and laid back. More of a chat than an interrogation and friendly. No difficult questions asked
Interview Questions: What can I bring to the role

title: Senior Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was a formal process. You applied online either internally or externally then if your application was successful you were emailed to confirm this and sent a date for interview. Then you attended face to face interview in front of a panel.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply for this role?

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Following application online, received an email informing me of interview date and time. The interview itself was a 30 minute, competency based interview. Following the interview was informed of the outcome by the HR recruiter. 

The interview itself was ok, but I felt the internal recruiter was so impersonal. Over a month later and I still haven’t received a single response to my requests for feedback, I find this really unprofessional.
Interview Questions: What skills will you bring to this role?

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University College Dublin in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: Skype interview with panel of four, lasted about an hour, questions pretty straightforward. Asked about past experience, current research, etc. Everyone friendly. Got job offer a few weeks later.
Interview Questions: Tell about your experience in...<specific subfield>

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University College Dublin in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: I take only one interview with my supervisor to discuss the Ph.D. proposal together. Further, we discuss the proposal of research. After I prepared everything I applied online for a scholarship and I got the offer after 3 month
Interview Questions: Most of the questions related to CV

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview took place on campus and lasted 25 minutes. There were three interviewers, I was not informed who they would be in advance. I was expected to give a 3-5 minute presentation about the department I was applying for at the start. This was followed by a very traditional interview with competency based questions ("Tell me about a time when..." etc). Most negative aspect was that they took over a month to make a decision. The time from initial application to final decision was two months.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a colleague who is a bad communicator?

title: Careers & Placement Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions:
- Application online.
- Notification of interview 2.5 weeks later. 9 days notice of on-site interview. 
- Interview panel released the day before the interview, not all listed were present at interview - no reference at interview to the absent panel member.
- Timeline for notification of outcome at interview was 1 week, no notification of outcome received for 2.5 weeks, following request for update.
- Delayed start to interview, shorter interview than outlined in advance.

Discussed some aspects of the job description with requests for examples, discussed motivation for application and for seeking a new position. 

Each panel member had a list of questions, questions sometimes repeated. 

Very little time allocated to discussing the role or follow-up questions by candidate.

No evidence of familiarity with candidate CV or application. Not a very modern approach to interviewing , poor understanding of private sector experiences/examples.

Interviewers seemed to take a very traditional approach to questions and from their attitudes seemed to be firmly steeped in a civil service/ higher education sector approach. 

Very poor candidate experience, interviewers seemed reluctant to engage or build rapport.
Interview Questions: What research did you do/ how did you learn about the school in preparation for the interview?

title: PhD Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Met casually with the professor of my research group. Spoke over a coffee. He emailed that night saying I had the place. Together we submitted an application to UCD for my PhD position. They accepted. I started a month later
Interview Questions:
Tell me about previous research projects
What are your research interests
Why this area
What skills do you want to develop

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Telephone interview, presentation and short chat. The process took approx. 3 weeks. It was relatively relaxed. Only basic questions regarding my previous research experiences. Got offered the position by email. Salary is not negotiable.
Interview Questions: What do you know about Ulcerative Colitis?

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: CVs were sent through HR, who then subsequently contacted me to attend interview. The job was for a position in a research lab and the interview itself was very informal with a HR person and lead PI asking me the usual questions of how i would fit the role, what are my best and worst skills. Finally, the main questions were theb usual type of interview questions.
Interview Questions: why did I want to work there?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: I emailed an application in reply to a class email about this position. I received a reply the following week and an interview was scheduled for two weeks after. The interview was relaxed and casual. I was offered the job a few weeks later with time to think about it.
Interview Questions: General questions about my experience in college at UCD

title: Digital Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions:
There was no real interviewing process. You have to fill out the online application and send in the documents required. Then it is really just waiting until you hear back from them if you go admitted or not. 
What i found helpful was to go to the school before applying and to talk to people there to get a better insight into what the school and degree is all about
Interview Questions: many questions about educational background and work experience in online application

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: I submitted a CV online and was called in for an interview over the Christmas break. It was held in the student centre at 15 minute intervals, so I met a few other candidates. I arrived very early, which they noticed and definitely appreciated. I also wore business clothing, which was good, because I subsequently noticed people being rejected straight away fro unprofessional dress.
Interview Questions: What relevant experience do you have?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Referral from a friend, met in office, took about an hour.  Friendly atmosphere and welcoming.  Talked in detail about my experience and was made feel at ease.  felt happy after the interview and got a call back soon after to invite be to work there immediately
Interview Questions: What was my experience relative to the role

title: Marketing Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin)
Interview Descriptions: There was a panel of three interviewers, two internal and one external. Each of the interviewers asked several questions, on their particular area of expertise. They were mostly polite, engaging and pleasant; one interviewer exuded an air of not being impressed, which was disconcerting. As in other interviews, they were interested in examples of relevant work and its impact / results.
Interview Questions: What does the UCD brand stand for?

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by PI and co PI, the interview just went through my previous education and grades and my research experience. It was pretty laid back overall. I was asked questions about my specific experience in the area and why I was interested in research specifically. I was also asked some very specific technical questions.
Interview Questions: What interests you about research?

title: Career & Skills Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was contacted within 2 weeks. The interview consisted of a 5-minute presentation that I was to prepare (and send in ahead of time) followed by a formal interview (mostly competency-based questions). There were 3 people on the panel representing the department - no HR.
Interview Questions: What does employability mean to you?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: great, the manager was excellent and very professional, I did not feel pressured at all. I wish more companies had this type of selection process. it all felt very transparent
Interview Questions: What is your teaching ackground

title: Executive Director Innovation Academy Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: After submitting CV online I was contacted by email with a proposed date for an interview. Panel interview with two academics, one HR and one entrepreneur. Interview over 1 hour. Two questions asked by each of the panel members. Time for questions at the end which openly clarified lack of flexibility by the panel for the terms of the appointment.
Interview Questions: How is it that your current company cannot make good use of your strong skills, knowing that your company obviously needs the skills you have?

title: PhD Candidate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Formal interview with members of teaching staff. Three members in total. Interview followed series of emails. Interview lasted 30min. Interviewers asked questions. They also showed a typical day in role.
Interview Questions: Future goals

title: PhD Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: My employer called me for an interview, we meet in his lab where I explained him my undergraduate studies, he showed me the instruments and we discussed about my previous experience in research and my interests for my future
Interview Questions:
What did you do in your master thesis?
What did you do in your bachelor thesis?
Do you like this lab?

title: Programmer Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University College Dublin
Interview Descriptions: Presentation on my background and suitability for the role. 30min interview
Interview Questions: Very straightforward questions mainly around the content of presentation

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: I only had 1 interview. You will need to discuss with the principal supervisor and his/her collaborator. The interview usually takes about half an hour. It is good to work here. They were quite nice.
Interview Questions: Technical questions. Please always prepare yourself.

title: PhD Candidate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: 3 phone interviews, 2 with UCD one with TDC, one informal 1:1 interview for which I had to fly to Dublin to perform. It was a good overall experience, I talked with researchers from different backgrounds and they asked various questions.
Interview Questions: why do you want to embark on this journey

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: Terrible it was very archaic and esoteric.  They didnt even know my name and I had to tell them who I was!  Look at what I wrote for the Interview question they asked me!
Interview Questions: What is your name?

title: Administrator  Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in Jun 2008
Interview Descriptions: The interview process took around 2 weeks to organise with HR making several calls to me to re-arrange the date and time of the interview. The interview itself consisted of a panel of 3 people, one of whom was from HR, one of whom was an academic and one of whom was an in admin. They were relatively friendly but not particularly encouraging. It was as if the person had already been chosed and they were simply going through the motions
Interview Questions: How many times have you had to deal with problems with an immediate superior?

title: Post Doctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University College Dublin (Dublin, Dublin) in May 2008
Interview Descriptions: Presentation and interview by phone. General questions about previous experience and skills.
Interview Questions: What kind of releted works you have done?
